challenge.title: Task 16
challenge.description:
Present continuous is used for actions happening at the moment of speaking. For example:

We're being successful with our marketing campaign (Notice how the verb to be was conjugated as being to demonstrate that this is true at the present moment).

Present continuous can be used in negative forms to express that something is not happening. For example:

I'm not working today (negative form)

They're not finding any solutions (negative form)

To be successful with something means achieving an objective.

question.text: Are Sarah and her team being successful in their search for patterns in customer data?

answers.answer: Yes, they are finding many interesting patterns
answers.feedback: Unfortunetely for Sarah, that is not the case.

answers.answer: No, they are not having any luck at the moment
Yes, they are not working on the project right now
answers.feedback: Sarah mentions they are looking at data but not finding patterns, not that they aren't working on it.

answers.answer: No, they are currently working on a different project
answers.feedback: Sarah says they are working on understanding customer data.

dialogue.text: I'm looking at customer data to find patterns.
We're trying to understand what our customers like and what they buy, but we're not having any luck at the moment.
